page.title: 05DECLINE OF WALTON AMENITIES.
page.content: As the survey went ahead and we went round the local streets, we were surprised by how few amenities there were. We expected to find a great deal to record and investigate but were disappointed. The local library had closed down. This used to be open full time but has now been replaced by a mobile library which parks on the recreation ground once a week. The old library buildings are now being used as a community centre. The post office has also closed down and this service has not been replaced. A similar thing has happened to many of the small 'corner' shops that were once quite common. These services are now supplied in the centre of town or in the new townships. This puts those people without transport at a disadvantage.
